text: Sola ran_________

options.A: round the town twice before supper
options.B: round the town before supper twice
options.C: round twice the town before supper
options.D: the town found before supper twice
options.E: twice round town before the supper

explanation: This option places "twice" after "round the town," which is the correct word order for indicating the number of times the action took place.

text: The Lagos Trade Fair________ annually.
explanation: This is because the Lagos Trade Fair takes place annually, which is a habitual or regular action, so the singular form "is held" is used.

text: He promised to do the work in no time. This means he would do the work__________
explanation: The phrase "in no time" means that something will be done very quickly or in a very short period.

text: The house is going under the hammer. This means the house is being___________
explanation: The phrase "going under the hammer" is an idiom commonly used to describe a property or item being auctioned. In an auction setting, the auctioneer often uses a hammer to signal the final bid and declare the item as sold to the highest bidder.

text: The Senate President was impeached for being too compromising with the executive and will replace him with a more official.
explanation: The word "compromising" means being willing to make concessions or accommodate the other party. The option that is most nearly opposite in meaning to "compromising" is:rigid."Rigid" means inflexible or unwilling to change, which contrasts with the idea of being compromising.

text: Evelyn believed in a pragmatic approach, whereas Tina’s approach is ..........
explanation: The word "pragmatic" refers to a practical, realistic approach to problems or situations. The option that is most nearly opposite in meaning to "pragmatic" istheoretical. This is because "theoretical" refers to ideas or concepts that are abstract or not grounded in practical experience.

text: John’s father has just bought a______________ car.
explanation:
This option follows the correct order of adjectives in English: opinion (brand new), size/shape/color (blue), origin (Japanese), and type (sports).
So, the sentence would read:"John’s father has just bought a brand new blue Japanese sports car."

text: Faruk _______ down while running the marathon.
explanation:
This is because the sentence suggests that Faruk was subject to an action (being pushed) while running the marathon, and this is best expressed in the passive form in the past continuous tense.
So, the sentence would read:"Faruk was pushed down while running the marathon."

text: Its high time we____________ discriminating against one another.
explanation:
The phrase"It's high time"is often followed by a verb in the past tense to suggest that something should have been done earlier, or it is now overdue. Therefore,"stopped"is the correct form to use here.
So, the sentence would read:"It's high time we stopped discriminating against one another."

text: The recent policy of the Central Bank about introducing higher denominations of the Naira has NOT allayed our fears about inflation; it has them as we had expected.
explanation: To "allay" means to put worries to rest, to ease. The opposite would be to "aggravate" which means to make a problem worse.

text: The driver inadvertently killed a man in an auto crash and was consequently convicted of ....................
explanation: Manslaughter refers to the unlawful killing of a person without premeditation and due to negligence or an accident, which fits the context of the driver inadvertently killing a man.

text: The Hausa language_______ in many parts of Africa.
explanation: The sentence refers to a general fact that is true in the present, so "is spoken" is the most appropriate choice.

text: I have never seen such a_________ dog always in the mood to attack.
explanation: A "vicious" dog refers to one that is aggressive, violent or prone to attacking, which fits the description of a dog always in the mood to attack. A "voracious" animal is one that has a large appetite.

text: Despite the Herculean task before the President, he still takes time off_________ to the Press.
explanation: The phrase "takes time off to talk" is grammatically correct. It implies that the President makes time for the purpose of talking to the press.

text: The___________ whale suddenly attacked the vessel on the Atlantic Ocean.
explanation: The word "gigantic" means extremely large. It is the best description for a whale attacking a vessel in the ocean.

text:
After the successful operation, he recovered by leaps and bound.
This means  ___________

options.B: His well-bound wounds aided his recovery in the middle of the night.
options.C: He did a lot of keep-fit exercises.

explanation: The expression "recovered by leaps and bounds" is an idiom that means someone's recovery or improvement is happening very rapidly and significantly. It suggests a swift and considerable progress in the person's health or well-being. Therefore, option A, "He got well very rapidly," is the most appropriate interpretation. The phrase "leaps and bounds" is commonly used to describe quick and substantial advancements or improvements in various contexts.

text: He was instructed to catch the thief dead or ______.
explanation: The opposite of "dead" is "alive".

text: The tax rebate was a concession given to the civil servants.
explanation: A "concession" in this context refers to something granted to relieve a burden, which is similar to "relief."

text: Tolu___________ here before my arrival.
explanation: The sentence refers to an action that was completed before the arrival, which requires the past perfect tense, "had left."

text: The boy is patently a rogue.
explanation: The word "patently" means something that is clearly or obviously true. Therefore, "obviously" is the nearest in meaning to "patently."

text: I am not going to do______________.
explanation: The sentence would read: "I am not going to do any more work today." This is the correct word order for expressing that no additional work will be done for the remainder of the day.

text: The man said that he________________

options.A: would sleep here a month ago
options.B: will sleep there a month ago
options.D: had slept there a month before

explanation: The sentence would read: "The man said that he had slept there a month before." This is the correct use of the past perfect tense, which is used to describe an action completed before another action in the past.

text: It may be unwise to consider any________ man your enemy.
explanation: The sentence would read: "It may be unwise to consider any mortal man your enemy." In this context, "mortal" refers to any human being.

text: The jilted woman eventually found herself at_______.
explanation: The phrase "at a crossroads" is an idiomatic expression to indicate a point of decision or an important juncture in life. Therefore, the sentence would read: "The jilted woman eventually found herself at a crossroads."

text: The new refinery will turn______ five million barrels of oil daily.
explanation:
The phrase "turn out" means to produce or manufacture something. For example, if a factory is said to "turn out" a certain number of products per day, it means the factory produces that many products daily.
So, in the sentence "The new refinery will turn out five million barrels of oil daily," the word "out" is used to indicate the production or processing of five million barrels of oil on a daily basis by the new refinery.

text: He denied that he________ the man.
explanation: In reported speech, "denied that he had seen" is appropriate because it indicates a past event that the speaker is denying.

text: Wole Soyinka gave his _________country a great award.
explanation: In this context, "home country" best fits the sentence, as it refers to Wole Soyinka's native or birth country.

text: The impertinent woman has just left here with her bag and baggage. This means she left with all her________.
explanation: The phrase "with her bag and baggage" means that the woman left with all of her belongings or possessions.

text: In computing, data is processed to give ___________
explanation: The word "information" is an uncountable noun, so it does not take an article like "an" or a plural form like "informations."

text: No sensible government will welcome subversive criticisms from the public.
explanation: "Subversive" describes actions or ideas intended to undermine or overthrow an established system in a harmful or destructive way. Therefore, "destructive" is the nearest in meaning to "subversive" in this context.

text: To keep our bodies healthy, we need a_________ diet.
explanation: A "balanced diet" refers to a diet that includes a variety of nutrients in the right proportions, which is essential for keeping our bodies healthy.

text: If he_______ there, he would have met him at home
explanation: The sentence requires the past perfect tense, "had gone," because it refers to a hypothetical situation in the past. The correct structure for third conditional sentences is "If + past perfect, ... would have + past participle."

text: Some people believe that it is ominous for the dog to bark at night.
explanation: "Ominous" refers to something that suggests or indicates a future event, often a negative or threatening one. Therefore, "threatening" is the nearest in meaning to "ominous."

text: Many people watched the kidnapper_________ by the angry mob.
explanation: The sentence describes an ongoing action (the kidnapper is in the process of being lynched by the mob). Therefore, "being lynched" is the most appropriate choice.

text: The introduction of religious fanaticism in state affairs is an ill wind that blows no one any good. This means that if is a ..........development.
explanation: The phrase "an ill wind that blows no one any good" refers to a harmful or negative development. Therefore, introducing religious fanaticism into state affairs would be considered a dangerous development.

text: If I_____ you, l would forgive the boy.
explanation: The sentence uses the conditional "If I were you," which is a common way to express a hypothetical situation in English. This structure is known as the subjunctive mood.
